definitions: characterized by or tending to concession

examples.text: we must look for a more concessive approach

shortDefinitions: characterized by or tending to concession

definitions: (of a preposition or conjunction) introducing a phrase or clause denoting a circumstance which might be expected to preclude the action of the main clause, but does not (e.g. in spite of, although).
shortDefinitions: (of preposition or conjunction) introducing phrase or clause denoting circumstance which might be expected to preclude action of main clause

definitions: (of a phrase or clause) introduced by a concessive preposition or conjunction.
shortDefinitions: introduced by concessive preposition or conjunction
